column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: slave. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix ont: <http://www.example.org/ontology#> .ont:Slave rdf:type rdfs:Class .ont:hasOrigin rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ont:Slave ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal .ont:heldBy rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ont:Slave ;    rdfs:range ont:Owner .ont:performsWork rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ont:Slave ;    rdfs:range ont:Work .ont:Work rdf:type rdfs:Class .ont:Owner rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:comment "The owner of the slave. Can be an individual or an institution." .ont:hasName rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain ont:Owner ;    rdfs:range xsd:string .ont:hasAge rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:range xsd:integer .ont:Spartacus rdf:type ont:Slave ;    ont:hasOrigin "Thrace" ;    ont:heldBy _:b0 ;    ont:performsWork ont:AgriculturalWork ._:b0 ont:hasName "Lentulus Batiatus" ;    rdf:type ont:Owner .ont:AgriculturalWork rdf:type ont:Work .```In this example, we are defining a simple ontology in the context of slavery. The main entities we've defined are `Slave`, `Owner`, and `Work`. In this context, a slave `hasOrigin`, is `heldBy` an owner, and `performsWork`. A practical instance of this ontology is `Spartacus`, a slave from `Thrace` who was held by the owner known as `Lentulus Batiatus`, and was expected to perform `AgriculturalWork`.
